metadata.title: CVE-2022-4900 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in PHP where setting the environment variablePHP_CLI_SERVER_WORKERS to a large value leads to a heap buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.21
libphp7.4-embed - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.21
php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.21
php7.4-bcmath - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.21
php7.4-bz2 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.21
php7.4-cgi - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.21
php7.4-cli - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.21
php7.4-common - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.21

criterions.comment: php7.4 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.4.3-4ubuntu2.21').
